[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Deserialize: Large inputs] [Memory exhaustion] Can attackers provide extremely long PathBuf strings or large nested configs during deserialization to exhaust memory and crash validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Deserialize: Type confusion] [Enum variant swap] Can serde deserialization be exploited to swap WaypointConfig or RoleType enum variants through type confusion attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Deserialize: Default poisoning] [Partial defaults] If deserialization partially fails, can the default() implementation be triggered mid-parse, creating partially valid configs that bypass security checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [API: PoemEnum exposure] [Role enumeration] RoleType derives PoemEnum for API exposure - can external attackers query node roles through APIs to identify validators for targeted attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [API: Config disclosure] [Path leakage] If BaseConfig is exposed through APIs or diagnostics, can data_dir and working_dir paths leak sensitive filesystem information to attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [API: Waypoint queries] [Consensus intelligence] Can attackers query waypoint values through APIs to understand consensus state and plan fork or eclipse attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Recovery: Panic unwind] [Unclean shutdown] When waypoint() panics, does the node perform clean shutdown and persist safety state, or can panics cause consensus state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Recovery: File recovery] [Waypoint loss] If waypoint files are accidentally deleted or corrupted, is there a recovery mechanism, or are validators permanently unable to restart? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Recovery: Storage fallback] [Backend failure handling] If SecureBackend storage fails, is there fallback mechanism, or do all validators crash simultaneously causing network halt? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Test: Missing coverage] [Untested paths] The test suite covers basic cases but may miss edge cases - can attackers exploit untested error paths in waypoint loading or role validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Test: FromStorage variant] [Untested backend] Tests don't cover WaypointConfig::FromStorage variant - are there untested vulnerabilities in storage backend integration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Test: Concurrent access] [Race conditions untested] Tests don't validate concurrent access to waypoint files or storage - can race conditions exist that only manifest under high load? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Test: File system errors] [I/O error paths] Tests don't simulate filesystem failures - can unexpected I/O errors during waypoint loading cause unhandled panics or data corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Platform: Windows paths] [Backslash handling] Are Windows path separators (backslash) properly handled in data_dir and waypoint paths, or can path normalization issues cause security bypasses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Platform: Unix permissions] [Umask issues] On Unix systems, are file permissions (umask) properly set when creating directories, or can world-readable directories leak validator data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Platform: macOS case-insensitive] [Path collision] On case-insensitive filesystems (macOS), can attackers create path collisions between DATA_DIR and data_dir causing unexpected behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Resource: File handle leaks] [Handle exhaustion] When reading waypoint files repeatedly, are file handles properly closed, or can handle exhaustion occur under high load causing validator failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Resource: Storage connections] [Connection pooling] When accessing SecureBackend storage, are connections properly pooled and closed, or can connection exhaustion crash validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Resource: Memory leaks] [Config caching] If BaseConfig instances are cached or cloned repeatedly, can memory leaks occur over time causing validator performance degradation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Governance: Role changes] [Unauthorized downgrade] Can validator role be changed to full_node without proper governance approval, removing stake-bearing validators from consensus arbitrarily? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Governance: Waypoint updates] [Fork enforcement] During chain upgrades, can attackers prevent waypoint updates to freeze validators on old forks, splitting the network? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Governance: Config distribution] [MITM attacks] When distributing updated BaseConfig to validators, can man-in-the-middle attacks inject malicious configs that redirect nodes to attacker-controlled chains? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Monitoring: Panic visibility] [Silent failures] When waypoint() panics during startup, are these failures properly logged and monitored, or can attackers cause silent validator failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Monitoring: Config changes] [Audit trail] Are changes to BaseConfig (role, waypoint, paths) logged with proper audit trails to detect unauthorized modifications? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/base_config.rs] [Monitoring: Role mismatch] [Detection gaps] If a node's configured role doesn't match its actual validator status on-chain, is this detected and alerted, or can inconsistencies persist unnoticed? (High)
